meanings.definition: Making a sucking noise while eating or drinking.
meanings.sent1: The baby slurped on her bottle noisily.
meanings.sent2: I always slurp my soup because it's too hot.
meanings.sent3: The cat slurped up the milk in one go.
meanings.sent4: The vacuum cleaner slurped up all the crumbs from the carpet.
meanings.sent5: The river slurped at the edges of the shore, creating a soothing sound.

meanings.definition: A type of beverage that is thick and can be drunk with a straw.
meanings.sent1: I ordered a slurpy at the movie theater.
meanings.sent2: The slurpy was so cold and refreshing on a hot day.
meanings.sent3: The kids loved sipping on their colorful slurpies.
meanings.sent4: The slurpy tasted like a mix of fruits and ice.
meanings.sent5: The slurpy melted quickly in the sun, turning into a sweet liquid treat.

meanings.definition: To consume something quickly and noisily.
meanings.sent1: He slurped down his drink in one gulp.
meanings.sent2: The dog slurped up the spilled milk from the floor.
meanings.sent3: She slurped the noodles so fast they disappeared in seconds.
meanings.sent4: The tornado slurped everything in its path, leaving a trail of destruction.
meanings.sent5: The vacuum cleaner slurped up the spilled cereal with ease.
